DOC.brief_title: Women With Cancer : An Exercise Study Promote Health
DOC.detailed_description: The propose study evaluate endurance-resistive exercise intervention attenuate effect menopause cancer treatment ( bone loss , increase body fat , decrease lean muscle mass , weight gain , decreased physical activity ) at-risk population female cancer survivor . Women solid tumor ( breast , gynecological , colo-rectal ) lymphoma complete primary and/or adjuvant therapy within past three year perimenopausal early postmenopausal woman Aromatase Inhibitor recruit participate randomize controlled trial ( RCT ) 12 month exercise intervention ( N=75 ) versus health promotion control group ( N=75 ) . The specific aim study : ( 1 ) examine effect exercise intervention bone mass ( serum biomarkers , lumbar spine , hip DEXA ) body composition ( whole body DEXA , weight , waist circumference ) , ( 2 ) examine effect exercise intervention metabolic risk factor ( lipid , cholesterol , fast glucose , insulin resistance , Hemoglobin A1-C , blood pressure ) , ( 3 ) examine effect exercise intervention functional status cardiovascular fitness ( exercise stress test ) .
